item.title: no-eval-in-markdown
item.description: Some tools use JavaScript to render OpenAPI docs. They can be vulnerable to XSS attacks if they render HTML/markdown from descriptions that contain malicious eval() calls. Why did this violation appear? There is JavaScript code using eval() defined in a description value. Bad example paths: /snakes/cakes: post: description: "This is a hack attack. <script>eval('alert(\'hacked!\')')</script>"; Good Example How do I fix this violation? Ensure there is no JavaScript or <script/> tags in any description.
